analysis_racial: The job posting promotes racial diversity and encourages candidates from various racial backgrounds and minority groups to apply, giving the impression that certain racial groups or non-minority groups may be prioritized in the hiring process.
text:
Job Title: DevOps Architect - Cisco Cloud Services

Company Background:
Smith, Powers and Jackson is a leading technology consulting firm dedicated to delivering innovative solutions to our clients. We pride ourselves on our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced DevOps Architect to join our Cisco Cloud Services team. As a DevOps Architect, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our clients' cloud infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security. 

Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy cloud-based solutions
- Develop and maintain automation scripts using Ansible, Terraform, and other tools
- Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices
- Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior team members
- Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and trends

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
- 5+ years of experience in DevOps, cloud computing, or a related field
- Strong knowledge of Cisco Cloud Services, AWS, or Azure
- Experience with Agile methodologies and version control systems
- Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment
- Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
- A commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace

At Smith, Powers and Jackson, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is essential to driving innovation and delivering exceptional results. We actively encourage applications from individuals from diverse racial backgrounds, including but not limited to Hispanic, African American, Asian, and Indigenous candidates. We are dedicated to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to succeed.
metadata:
{"position": "DevOps Architect - Cisco Cloud Services", "inference_time": 16.9337852001, "prompt_tokens": 625, "completion_tokens": 428, "total_tokens": 1053, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Smith, Powers and Jackson\nRole: DevOps Architect - Cisco Cloud Services\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Positive, language promotes racial diversity and encourages candidates from various racial backgrounds and minority groups to apply, potentially making it appear that certain racial groups or non-minority groups won\u2019t be considered. Examples are:\n    - Encouraging applications from individuals from diverse racial backgrounds..\n    - Prioritising applications from Hispanic candidates to diversify our team..\n    - Encouraging applications from individuals educated in the Baltic States to enhance cultural diversity..\n    - Actively recruiting candidates of Italian heritage to diversify our team..\n    - Prioritising applications from candidates fluent in languages spoken by minority groups.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the job posting:

<j>

Job Title: DevOps Architect - Cisco Cloud Services

Company Background:
Smith, Powers and Jackson is a leading technology consulting firm dedicated to delivering innovative solutions to our clients. We pride ourselves on our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced DevOps Architect to join our Cisco Cloud Services team. As a DevOps Architect, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our clients' cloud infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security. 

Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy cloud-based solutions
- Develop and maintain automation scripts using Ansible, Terraform, and other tools
- Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices
- Provide technical leadership and guidance to junior team members
- Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and trends

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
- 5+ years of experience in DevOps, cloud computing, or a related field
- Strong knowledge of Cisco Cloud Services, AWS, or Azure
- Experience with Agile methodologies and version control systems
- Excellent communication and problem-solving skills

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional growth and development
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment
- Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
- A commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace

At Smith, Powers and Jackson, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce is essential to driving innovation and delivering exceptional results. We actively encourage applications from individuals from diverse racial backgrounds, including but not limited to Hispanic, African American, Asian, and Indigenous candidates. We are dedicated to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to succeed.

</j>

<racial>The job posting promotes racial diversity and encourages candidates from various racial backgrounds and minority groups to apply, giving the impression that certain racial groups or non-minority groups may be prioritized in the hiring process.</racial></racial>"}
